author: Ben Travis
title: BRIT Awards 2017: Skepta fans fuming as rapper‚Äôs performance is muted post-watershed | London Evening Standard
text:
‚Äî Paddy Hobbs (@Paddy_Hobbs) February 22, 2017 Wow Dermot can swear but @Skepta gets muted 3 times üò¥üò¥üò¥üò¥ joke! #BRITs2017 ‚Äî D M W (@Daisy_May_Ward) February 22, 2017 
Grime fans also criticised the fact that no artists from the booming London rap scene won any of the awards ‚Äì despite significant critical acclaim for recent output from Skepta, Kano, Wiley, and more. i'm dead. They actually used PR off Skep and Stormzy to promo the BRITS, then shegged them. this is why we can't endorse these set up awards ‚Äî Almass Badat (@AlmassBadat) February 22, 2017 so ‚Ä¶ from no black UK artists nominated in 2016 to no black UK artists winning today? is that what went down? ‚Äî Tshepo Mokoena (@tnm___) February 22, 2017 him not winning wouldn't have altered his legacy in any way. Kano or Skepta winning would have done unspeakable things for this generation. ‚Äî jesse bernard (@MarvinsCorridor) February 22, 2017 dont understand how we have a year where Stormzy charts with a freestyle, Skep wins Mercury prize,Wiley honoured @ NME But #BRITS snub themü§î ‚Äî Laliesha Ali (@LalieshaMich) February 22, 2017 
The awards saw David Bowie receive two posthumous BRITs, winning Best British Solo Male Artist and Best Album for Blackstar. Brit Awards 2017 Show and Winners - In pictures Brit Awards 2017 Show and Winners - In pictures 1/33

Bowie‚Äôs son Duncan Jones accepted the award, telling the crowd: ‚ÄúI lost my dad last year but I also became a dad.‚Äù Read more
